org.jmlspecs.jmlunitng.strategy
Class ArrayStrategy

java.lang.Object
  org.jmlspecs.jmlunitng.strategy.NonPrimitiveStrategy
      org.jmlspecs.jmlunitng.strategy.ArrayStrategy
All Implemented Interfaces:
Strategy
public abstract class ArrayStrategy
extends NonPrimitiveStrategy

The strategy for all array types. It attempts to generate arrays of lengths up to a specified maximum, using strategies for the array component type.

Version:
January 2011
Author:
Daniel M. Zimmerman

Constructor Detail

ArrayStrategy

public ArrayStrategy(Class<?> the_class)
              throws IllegalArgumentException
Creates a new ArrayStrategy for the given class. Default values will be generated by using the strategy for the array's component type (and any subtypes specified post-construction). By default, the maximum size array to be generated is 1.

Parameters:
the_class - The array class for which to generate test data.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the_class is not an array type.
Method Detail

defaultValues

public RepeatedAccessIterator<?> defaultValues()
Returns an iterator of arrays. If reflection is turned on, all possible arrays up to the maximum array length will be generated using elements taken from the generators found for the specified data classes; otherwise, only the null array and the empty array will be generated.

Returns:
An Iterator over default values.

setMaxLength

public final void setMaxLength(int the_max_length)
Sets the maximum array length to generate. Increasing this value can result in many additional data values being generated, so use caution.

Parameters:
the_max_length - The maximum array length to generate.

maxLength

public final int maxLength()
Returns:
the maximum array size to generate.
